intro: Hydrolea elatior, commonly known as the greater hydrolea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. Hydrolea elatior is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
